comments.commentBody: Why stop at Bush? Why not blame Reagan? Heck. He left office over a quarter century ago and since then we've had more years of Democratic POTUS rule than Republican, yet it is something everyone on the left "knows" that Ronny caused all of our mental health treatment problems. Heck. blame Nixon for wage stagnation because he opened the door to relations with the PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC of China. What about Eisenhower. The interstate highway system opened the door for globalization, unleashing unfettered capitalism and destroying local businesses. It's easy.
... yep ... it's a win-win game for "The Donald", and now the rest of the field is reduced to cussing each other out.  No one ever said Trump was stupid ... he's just crazy.

This is brilliant in both the short and long game. Short: He avoids all the establishment hacks swinging for a knockout blow on Thurs. Long game: In the general, swinging moderates will love that he told Fox News to take a hike.
... don't worry ... she will be the First Female President of America (Nancy Reagan doesn't count).

Thanks, Marcus. My fear is that Hillary Clinton is too ashamed to push herself as the first woman president, to the max. I suggest that she use the "V"sign, with both hands together, to form at "W" (V V) for WOMAN. But I am afraid she lacks to Chutzpah to do something like that.

Trump, I believe would not be afraid to use his merits to the max. Perhaps, Hillary will wake up, before it is too late. Time will tell...

Donald Trump always seems to have the trump card. I support Hillary Clinton and I wish she too had Chutzpah. I think the American people want the next president to be interesting, all the time. The Donald is always interesting and perhaps he will be remembered as the candidate who made politics interesting, again.

As a Clinton supporter, I am hoping that she find some Chutzpah, before it is too later. I suggest that she push the idea of a woman president to the max. I believe this is her trump card. People will say, it's not fair asking people to vote for you because you are a woman. So, I am afraid that Hillary will not rise to the occasion in her campaign.

Thank you Donald for waking the country up!
==================================

For crying out loud, you guys are contributing to this mess.  If you all had NOT gone into coverage overdrive and simply just reported DT wasn't going to be at the debate and moved on the story would be dead.  But now he's gobbled up all the airspace, leaving room for nothing else of consequence.  Please stop. Stop reporting on DT with breathlessness more appropriate for a teen agent front of their favorite rock star, he's not new, he's a major distraction and embarrassment.

I have no idea whether or not Trump would (will?) make a good president--or even if he will get the GOP nomination. But, if nothing else at all is accomplished, Trump has blown a "huuuge" hole in the DC cartel of lobbyists and shadowy PACmen who have corrupted the American political system for years.
Anybody who diminishes the influence of the likes of Karl Rove, Rupert Murdoch and the Koch Brothers can't be all bad.
Who knows? Maybe, in his own odd way, Trump actually will end up "making America great again."

"Mr. Trump was deeply disappointed and bothered by the personal nature of the statement,..............because in his view, it was the type of statement a political campaign, not a television news organization, would make." So Trump didn't know Fox is a political campaign? It's not called Faux News for nothing.
You might not be that far off....give it a decade or two.
Yup.  Been sayin' it for months. So that makes Mr. Genius right.  Mexico will pay for the wall.  And it will have his name on it. "Built to keep out TRUMP."
You're proud to be speaking the language of the conquistadores?  Why is this fact never addressed?
If this is a preview of America made great again, Mexico WILL build a wall to stem the flow of Americans seeking refuge.
I don't think viewership will go down. I, for once, may watch to hear what others have to say without being drawn into a Trump circus.
Same here!

This was Trump's red line. He cannot back down without appearing weak. Without Trump, the debate viewership will plummet.
In this battle - as Trump would say - Fox News is the loser.

Ailes and Murdoch are pulling in different directions.  Aisles, usually adept and assured has become the story.  Trump has again been enabled by being given all the oxygen.  Cruz and his PAC are trying to stick the pig by offering $1.5M to Wounded Vets for a DT/Cruz one on one debate.   Trump can slam them by upping the entry fee to something ''that will REALLY mean something to the VETS!'' - Like $15M.  This way, if they say ''no'' they are cheap shots.  If they say ''yes'' Trump has a win/win - without cracking open his wallet he's given $15M to the Vets.  Then, he sets the rules for the debate.  If Cruz's side starts to whine, Trump throws down the gauntlet and accuses them of backing out and ''Stabbing the Vets in the back, just like Cruz would if elected, unless he speaks out against this outrage by HIS PEOPLE.''  - Really, they think they're in control and they just stepped into Donald's parlor.  Ailes is in a power struggle for his job with the younger Murdoch generation, and he is on the verge of being retired.  That's the real story here.

Let me get this right: The Benghazi debacle and Hillary's secret hidden email server are now selling points for her campaign because she demonstrated she can stonewall and evade for an afternoon?

By the way, the FBI will indict her for compromising state security. And now they are investigating that little merry-go-round between her State Department and all the business dealings of her 'charity'.

Hillary Clinton is the epitome of everything Democrats claim they hate. And you will all vote for her because while she's a grifter and a handmaiden for Wall Street, she's *your* grifter and handmaiden for Wall Street.

Mr. Trump showed something else.  He showed that if something is not a good deal, you walk.  You walk from a lousy Iran deal instead of making a lousy deal just for the sake of it.  You do not make a lousy deal, Simpson-Bowles, just to make a deal.  You do not make lousy unenforceable trade deals like TPP just to have a deal.  Murdoch was preparing a buzz saw for the leading candidate, hardly a real debate and Mr. Trump chose not to play.
Like all bullies, underneath the Trump bluster is ..... cowardice.

What I want and I think everyone should want in our next president is someone that can take the heat. The Donald has shown he can't. Compare his reaction to Megan Kelly's questions to the way Hillary comported herself for 11 HOURS in front of a group that was openly out to get her. Do you think the Donald could handle that pressure?

The moment FOX "publicly" put their anti-Trump post, they became an opponent.  It's Ok for Cruz to ridicule Trump, he is running for president. But not FOX news, specially when they are moderating an even where a certain level of impartiality is expected from them. Yes, Trump may have been wrong in his fight with Kelly. But he is surely right in not walking into the FAUX trap --- specially when he leads by a handsome margin.

Yup. If the ratings are low Trump will say it's because he wasn't there.

If ratings are high he'll say it's because viewers tuned in to see if he'd make an appearance.

He can't lose this battle.

But he won't win the war.
I'm not sure he wants to win. I think he is having fun but would crumble under four years of often mudane 24/7 responsibilities.
PR stunt.
... don't ... you'll be diagnosed as bi-polar.

"Mr. Trump said the final straw was a sarcastic press statement Fox News released on Tuesday, which jokingly questioned how he would handle President Vladimir Putin of Russia and Ayatollah Ali Khamenei of Iran if he could not handle Ms. Kelly."

As much as I abhor what Fox News has done to this country (they are propagandists with a capital P), their press statement may have been, as Trump suggests, "sarcastic", but they weren't "jokingly questioning" anything. Asking "how he would handle President Vladimir Putin of Russia and Ayatollah Ali Khamenei of Iran if he could not handle Ms. Kelly.", is a legitimate question...

And it's pretty scary to me that I'm agreeing with Fox News.
DT in his new routine at the gym: The Trump Jerk and Press.

Journalistic standards? What are you talking about? This is Fox News, for which ratings, lies and slander are the only standard. Serious people and professional journalists don't have a dog in this fight.

Let the fur fly, and let's hope that it destroys both Trump's and Fox's credibility even in the eyes of the deluded people who follow them.

comments.userDisplayName: Divorce is Good For American Economy
comments.commentBody: Yet another meisterstick from Trump. Who else might be ever able to stick it to Murdoch's unfair and unbalance Fox pseudonews. Go, Donald, go!
Thanks Megyn Kelly, it took a Woman to do the job no Man could do!
Actually, a candidate who blackmails and threatens a media outlet don't win me over

Trump's row with Fox is strategic brilliance in that he knows he must win over the middle during the general. His recent tactical stunt belies his conservatism but who better to pick as punching bag than a liberal bashing network if you want to pick up moderate votes...

comments.userDisplayName: Divorce is Good For American Economy
comments.commentBody:
Bingo!

Only Trump has the guts and the skills to stick it - on top of that in such huge public way - to Murdoch's farce of news.

comments.userDisplayName: Divorce is Good For American Economy
comments.commentBody:
You are right about Ronnie, who was in the end supported by blue collar voters, traditionally voting Dems.

Like Reagan, Trump knows how to use media.
Establishment, especially GOP leadership are scared and panicking. TRump does better than Ross Perot ... and it costs him nothing, all free publicity.

Go, Donald, go!

Right now, it looks like Hillarys best chance at getting nominated rest on her firewall the southern states. That means the justification for her nomination is on the southern states.

Think about that for a moment.

How many southern states is Hillary likely to win in the general election? Few or none.

Winning the general election means winning the purple states. Winning the purple states means attracting independents - something that Sanders is much better at, and generating a lot of enthusiasm with democrats to get them to show up to vote, something Sanders is also much better at.

Hillary preaching the audacity of nope, no we can not, and no change/more of the same is not going to stimulate a high voter turn out.

This kind of analysis is quite damning of Hillary.

@bob:

No. The all-too-visible hand of corruption at work -- debasing an entire public health system. Scalpers are "rentiers", middle-men. They buy their place by paying bribes. Those bribes travel to the top of the hierarchy in that hospital system, why no one in authority intercedes. That bribe money is confiscated from the neediest and most desperate; there for that reason.

It's here, too. Just try to find affordable generic prescription drugs.

Melissa has a nice discussion of how to cook beans in the original article (see link with recipe if my pasted link doesn't workhttp://mobile.nytimes.com/2016/01/13/dining/how-to-cook-beans-recipes-ti...
I am going to use canned, because it's easy, but "from scratch" beans are best.

The anti-corruption campaign of Xi Jinping has been labeled an intraparty dispute by many foreign observers in that no one from areas that Xi occupied on the way up show in the list of Tigers and Flees falling. In an organization as tightly nit as the Communist Party  internal struggles do not hit the headlines, that Xi has released this publication it is safe to assume he has a clear field for whatever his major reforms may be. The first five year of a ten year term are coming to a close and Xi’s extensive activities in foreign policy, building world wide networks of alliances and an International Bank to challenge the IMF, are significant. Domestic Reform and shifting to a consumer economy may be worth watching in the coming period. Are is the economy on the way to stagnation as some observers claim? For the health of the world economy let’s hope not.

comments.userDisplayName: Divorce is Good For American Economy
comments.commentBody: Trump is smart and - at no cost - he continues an unbelievably long and successful run scaring the establishment. His sticking it to Murdoch's unfair and unbalanced "news" is a historic achievement, days before Iowa.
